The radar emits radio waves with each emission lasting 1μs and an interval of 100μs between emissions.
The distance between the radar and the obstacle can be calculated using the speed of light and the time delay.
The time delay for the round trip of the radio waves is twice the time it takes for the waves to reach the obstacle and return.
Since ab = bc, the total time delay for the round trip is 2ab.
The time delay for the round trip is 150μs, so the one-way trip time is 75μs.
Using the speed of light c = 3.0 × 10^8 m/s, the distance is calculated as distance = speed × time = 3.0 × 10^8 m/s × 75 × 10^-6 s = 7.5 × 10^3 m.
